public class zeta.util.Name

(source file: Name.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.util.Term
           |
           +----zeta.util.Name
The pure class interface. 
public class Name
  extends Term
  implements Ordered<A>
A Name is a wrapper around an interned String, with special methods for handling Z style decoration. Decoration is implemented for reasons of efficiency literally on the level of the string representation. In order to build a decorated name, one writes e.g. 
   new Name(base + prime)
The literal syntax for names is as follows: 
       ( CHARACTER \ {prime,input,output,index}  )+ 
       ( prime | input | output | index (CHARACTER \ {index})* index )*
prime, input, output and index are the characters `'', `?', `!' and `#', respectively. Note that the representation of index is not the same as under LaTeX, and when producing output for LaTeX, has to be substituted accordingly (by _{...}).

Version: $Id: Name.pizza,v 1.2 2000/01/02 17:35:37 wg Exp $

hashCode in class Object

compareTo

public int compareTo(Name other);
Name ordering. Represents a total order on names. Note that, for reasons of efficiency, this order does not necessarily coincides with the lexical ordering of the string representation of names.

lexCompare

public static int lexCompare(Name n1,
                             Name n2);
Static method for lexical comparsion of two names.

stdName

public static Name stdName(String base);
Make a ``standard'' name from the Z LaTeX representation.

internName

public static Name internName(String base);
Make an ``internal'' name. An internal name is guaranteed to be disjunct from any names which can be defined by external representation.

getRepr

public String getRepr();
Get representation of Name, including embedded decoration

clone

public Object clone();
Clones a name. Since a name is immutable, actually ``this'' is returned.

valueOfIndex

public static String valueOfIndex(String stroke);
Get value of index stroke.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if passed string is not an index stroke, at is starts and ends with Name.index

getComponents

public String[] getComponents();
Return array of strings describing components of this name. The first entry in the array is the base name, the remaining entries contain decoration strokes.
